definition: To disintegrate or fall apart, often used to describe the gradual or sudden collapse of a complex structure or system. This term is commonly employed to depict the fragmentation or breakdown of relationships, organizations, or plans due to internal or external factors.

examples.german: Die alten Mauern des Schlosses fallen auseinander.
examples.english: The old walls of the castle are falling apart.

examples.german: Die Gruppe konnte sich nicht einigen und fiel auseinander.
examples.english: The group couldn't agree and fell apart.

examples.german: Die zerbrechliche Vase fiel auseinander, als sie auf den Boden fiel.
examples.english: The fragile vase fell apart when it hit the floor.
